definition: important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: Our ancestor's secrets remain safe - at least for now.
sentences.chinese: 至少目前爲止，這些人類祖先的祕密仍然諱莫如深。

sentences.english: China manages its reserves with considerable secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 中國於外匯儲備經營之道一向諱莫如深。

sentences.english: The lack of transparency from Apple creates a perfect storm for short-term traders.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果的諱莫如深爲短線交易者帶來了一場完美風暴。

sentences.english: Wong Kwong Yu about how to start their own has been a closely-guarded secret.
sentences.chinese: 黃光裕對於自己如何起家，一直諱莫如深。

sentences.english: Details of his health have been kept secret by the Cuban government.
sentences.chinese: 古巴政府對他的健康詳情諱莫如深。

sentences.english: It has reason to be diffident.
Despite such overdrafts word about it, but it is in reality.
sentences.chinese: 儘管人們對這類透支諱莫如深，但它卻是現實存在。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
